on chains is constantly observing your

is built on top of kubernetes and
to some extent we are also trusting
kubernetes when we're trusting tecton
the problem here is that anyone with
access to your kubernetes cluster can go
in and edit a task run so for example if
i'm the admin of my kubernetes cluster i
could go in and edit every task run i
see to say that no image was built or to
say that a different image was built
tucked on chains will pick up on that
task run believe whatever it's saying
and attempt to sign and generate
provenance for that image
so you can see how this is not actually

the identity of the machine you're

when you include spire as part of your
entire supply chain you're signing you

level two is all about having that

and every time you create an artifact

the next level up from there is salsa
